axiomAlignment.A1_verifiability: Object type definitions enable verifiable ABAP repository structure and dependencies

axiomAlignment.A4_non_harm: Proper object typing prevents incorrect usage and transport issues
axiomAlignment.A5_consistency: Unified TADIR catalog ensures consistent naming and development across systems

anti_patterns.name: Using wrong object type for the purpose
anti_patterns.problem: Creating PROG instead of CLAS for reusable logic, or TABL instead of DDLS for RAP development leads to architectural issues and maintenance problems
anti_patterns.fix: Understand object type purpose: use CLAS for reusable logic, DDLS for data models, BDEF for behavior definitions

anti_patterns.name: Mixing object types in wrong packages
anti_patterns.problem: Scattering related objects across multiple packages makes transport management difficult and breaks object relationships
anti_patterns.fix: Group all objects for one business domain in the same DEVC package

anti_patterns.name: Creating objects in $TMP package for production code
anti_patterns.problem: $TMP objects cannot be transported, leading to code duplication and inconsistency across systems
anti_patterns.fix: Always use transportable packages (Z* or Y*) for any code that needs to move between systems

anti_patterns.name: Ignoring object type relationships
anti_patterns.problem: Creating BDEF without DDLS, or SRVB without SRVD breaks the RAP architecture and causes runtime errors
anti_patterns.fix: Follow proper object creation sequence: create dependent objects (DDLS) before dependent ones (BDEF, SRVD)

anti_patterns.name: Not documenting custom object types
anti_patterns.problem: Undocumented custom object types confuse developers and make maintenance difficult
anti_patterns.fix: Always add descriptions in TADIR (transaction SE80) and create technical documentation explaining object purpose and usage
